intro: Cyrtandra strictipes, commonly known as the rigid cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including Hawaii and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white or pale yellow blossoms. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
